addBridgeTokenSender(address).custom:security: Only authorized addresses should be able to add bridge token senders
addBridgeTokenSender(address).details: Adds a new bridge token sender

params._bridgeTokenSender: Address of the bridge token sender to add

bridgeTokenSenders(uint256,uint256).details: Returns the bridge token sender for a specific chain and index

params._index: Index of the bridge token sender

returns._0: Address of the bridge token sender

burn(uint256).custom:security: Users can only burn their own tokens
burn(uint256).details: Burns tokens from the caller's balance

burnMock(uint256).custom:security: This function should only be available in test environments
burnMock(uint256).details: Burns mock tokens for testing purposes

params._amount: Amount of mock tokens to burn

getBridgeTokenSendersLength(uint256).details: Returns the number of bridge token senders for a specific chain

returns._0: Number of bridge token senders for the chain

grantMintAndBurnRoles(address).custom:security: Only the contract owner should be able to grant roles
grantMintAndBurnRoles(address).details: Grants mint and burn roles to a specified address

params._to: Address to grant the roles to

mint(address,uint256).custom:security: Only authorized addresses should be able to mint tokens
mint(address,uint256).details: Mints new tokens to a specified address

params._to: Address to receive the minted tokens

mintMock(address,uint256).custom:security: This function should only be available in test environments
mintMock(address,uint256).details: Mints mock tokens for testing purposes

params._amount: Amount of mock tokens to mint
params._to: Address to receive the minted mock tokens

addBridgeTokenSender(address).notice: This function registers a new bridge token sender for cross-chain operations

burn(uint256).notice: This function destroys tokens from the caller's balance

burnMock(uint256).notice: This function is used for testing and development

grantMintAndBurnRoles(address).notice: This function authorizes an address to mint and burn tokens

mint(address,uint256).notice: This function creates new tokens and assigns them to the recipient

mintMock(address,uint256).notice: This function is used for testing and development
